Patients.What issues have patients reported with: Cracked retainer ring, broken belt clip/rails, cracked battery‑tube threads, cracked LCD/case, keypad overlay peeling, missing O‑ring; several cosmetic/physical damages (e.g., MDRs 13126040, 13125160, 13124964).
Patients.Has the belt clip broken or cracked in r: Yes. Reports note broken/cracked belt‑clip rails, cracked corners, and failed plate welds (e.g., MDRs 13126040, 13125903).
Patients.Are cosmetic damages like cracked batter: Yes. Multiple FOI_TEXT entries cite cracked battery‑tube threads, cracked retainer rings, and scratched/cracked display or case (MDRs 13125827, 13124944, 13124831).
Patients.Are there any reports describing nausea,: Yes. MDR 13124913 reports hyperglycemia, nausea, vomiting, and DKA.
Patients.Was a patient hospitalized due to pump m: Yes. MDR 13124913 describes a multi‑day hospital admission for very high glucose associated with a reported motor/pump error.
Patients.Do any patients describe removing or rep: Yes. Several entries note pumps returned or replaced after malfunction or damage (e.g., MDRs 13124913, 13126040).
Patients.Are users reporting device leaks or insu: Indirectly. Flow‑blocked alarms and critical pump errors are reported (e.g., MDR 13124964), suggesting delivery obstruction; explicit leaks are not confirmed.

Doctors.What clinical symptoms are mentioned in: Nausea, vomiting, hyperglycemia, DKA, dizziness, and hospitalization are described (notably MDR 13124913).
Doctors.Do any reports mention symptoms like fat: DKA is documented in MDR 13124913; nausea/vomiting and high glucose are common. Fatigue/headache are not clearly documented.
Doctors.Are there descriptions of ER visits due: Yes. MDR 13124913 includes ER/hospital care for severe hyperglycemia linked to motor/pump error.
Doctors.Are there cases where alarm failures are: Yes. “Critical pump error”/motor error alarms are cited (e.g., MDRs 13125039, 13124913), with clinical impact in the latter.
Doctors.What does the report describe about moto: Mentions include “motor error”, “critical pump error”, “alarm 25”, and an “open book image” (MDRs 13125039, 13124913).
Doctors.Are users describing unresponsive or non: Yes. Some reports mention non‑working action buttons or inability to deliver insulin even if later bench tests pass (MDRs 13124613, 13124808).
Doctors.Are there descriptions of delayed insuli: Yes. MDR 13124913 indicates failed/delayed delivery leading to very high glucose and DKA.

Manufacturer.What does the FOI_TEXT say about the ret: Cracked, detached, missing, and loose retainer rings recur (MDRs 13126040, 13125955, 13125157, 13124938).
Manufacturer.Are there descriptions of broken or deta: Yes. Broken welds, cracked clip corners, and damaged slots are reported (MDRs 13125903, 13124808).
Manufacturer.Are adhesive failures or peeling overlay: Yes. “Keypad overlay peeling/damage” occurs in multiple cases (MDRs 13124944, 13124831).
Manufacturer.Are cracks in the device case mentioned: Yes. “Cracked battery tube”, “cracked display corner”, and “cracked above battery icon” appear often (MDRs 13125827, 13124938, 13124808).
Manufacturer.What problems are described with insulin: Flow‑blocked/pump‑error alarms, cracked casings, and non‑functioning action buttons (MDRs 13124964, 13124613).
Manufacturer.Which kinds of malfunctions are mentione: Motor/critical pump errors, flow‑blocked alarms, battery‑compartment damage, broken display, overlay peeling; DKA context in MDR 13124913.

Regulators.Are there any cases where the adverse ev: Yes. Several MDRs have AE_FLAG = N but model predicts injury/malfunction (e.g., 13126040, 13125039).
Regulators.Does the FOI_TEXT describe harm or devic: Yes. Multiple entries describe damage/failure; MDR 13124913 shows clear injury despite AE flag inconsistencies.
Regulators.Can a device be tagged with physical_dam: Yes. Many physical‑damage cases are flagged “No AE” (e.g., MDRs 13125827, 13125903).
Regulators.Are injury or malfunction related keywor: Yes. Terms like “hyperglycemia”, “hospitalized”, “cracked”, and “motor error” appear even when AE_FLAG = N.
